instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: 8230-3435 air 11 power button
threads.message: some keys did not work, i replaced it, and actually even with the original keyboard, and now with new keyboard and new trackpad, when i press the power button right away it restarts...  it powers on when i connect the charger after removing the battery, and works fine, all the keys are working, mouse is moving fine, until i hit the power button, then restart re quick, the charger light goes to green when i do the SMC reset, the board is not water damaged

threads.title: 8230-3435 air 11 power button
threads.message: Have you tried a new trackpad cable as well? What is happening is the power button is resetting the SMC. Likely trackpad/trackpad cable. If no, then could be corrosion on the <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> pin of the keyboard connector or corrosion near <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> or under the SMC.

threads.title: 8230-3435 air 11 power button
threads.message: i did not notice a small water damage on <RESISTOR>R4860</RESISTOR>, 100k resistor was corroded, fixed, works
